meanings.definition: To introduce semen into the reproductive tract of a female
meanings.sent1: Farmers inseminate cows to help them have babies.
meanings.sent2: The veterinarian will inseminate the mare to breed her.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy farmer accidentally inseminated the wrong cow!
meanings.sent4: His words were like seeds inseminated in her mind, growing into ideas.
meanings.sent5: The idea he shared was inseminated in their minds, spreading like wildfire.

meanings.definition: To sow seeds in soil or other growth medium
meanings.sent1: Gardeners inseminate the soil with various seeds for a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent2: The farmer will inseminate the field with corn seeds next week.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to inseminate the bird feeder with acorns!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter inseminated joy in the hearts of everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush inseminated the canvas with vibrant colors, bringing the painting to life.
